About Yasca

Yasca is a multi-platform static analysis tool designed to help developers create high-quality, secure software. More information can be found at yasca.org.

Yasca Version: 3.0.5

The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the site on behalf of the\r\nattacker, or to simply steal the session cookie.\r\n\r\nA solution to this problem would be HtmlEncoding at the in the database layer of an application. in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. in the database layer of an application. password was chosen that falls into\r\none of the following categories:\r\n\r\n* Repeated String (i.e. foo2foo)\r\n* Password Matching UserID\r\n* Blank UserID\/Password\r\n* Password Ending in \"4ever\"\r\n* Seasonal Password (i.e. summer12)\r\n* Common Password (based on reported \"most common\" passwords)\r\n\r\nIf these passwords are required to remain hard-coded, they should be changed in the database layer of an application. Attack","http:\/\/www.ibm.com\/developerworks\/tivoli\/library\/s-csscript\/":"IBM: Cross-site scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the site on behalf of the\r\nattacker, or to simply steal the session cookie.\r\n\r\nA solution to this problem would be HtmlEncoding at the Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. SQL injection\r\nattacks are also known as SQL insertion attacks.","filename":"\/newsportal\/admin\/manage-comments.php","lineNumber":13,"message":"\t$query=mysqli_query($con,\"update tblcomments set status='0' where id='$id'\");","unsafeSourceCode":{"3":"error_reporting(0);","4":"if(strlen($_SESSION['login'])==0)","5":" { ","6":"header('location:index.php');","7":"}","8":"else{","9":"if( $_GET['disid'])","10":"{","11":"\t$id=intval($_GET['disid']);","12":"\t$query=mysqli_query($con,\"update tblcomments set status='0' where id='$id'\");","13":"\t$msg=\"Comment unapprove \";","14":"}","15":"\/\/ Code for restore","16":"if($_GET['appid'])","17":"{","18":"\t$id=intval($_GET['appid']);","19":"\t$query=mysqli_query($con,\"update tblcomments set status='1' where id='$id'\");","20":"\t$msg=\"Comment approved\";","21":"}","22":""}},{"severity":1,"category":"SQL Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. SQL injection\r\nattacks are also known as SQL insertion attacks.","filename":"\/newsportal\/admin\/manage-subcategories.php","lineNumber":13,"message":"\t$query=mysqli_query($con,\"update tblsubcategory set Is_Active='0' where SubCategoryId='$id'\");","unsafeSourceCode":{"3":"error_reporting(0);","4":"if(strlen($_SESSION['login'])==0)","5":" { ","6":"header('location:index.php');","7":"}","8":"else{","9":"if($_GET['action']=='del' && $_GET['scid'])","10":"{","11":"\t$id=intval($_GET['scid']);","12":"\t$query=mysqli_query($con,\"update tblsubcategory set Is_Active='0' where SubCategoryId='$id'\");","13":"\t$msg=\"Category deleted \";","14":"}","15":"\/\/ Code for restore","16":"if($_GET['resid'])","17":"{","18":"\t$id=intval($_GET['resid']);","19":"\t$query=mysqli_query($con,\"update tblsubcategory set Is_Active='1' where SubCategoryId='$id'\");","20":"\t$msg=\"Category restored successfully\";","21":"}","22":""}},{"severity":1,"category":"SQL Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. SQL injection\r\nattacks are also known as SQL insertion attacks.","filename":"\/newsportal\/admin\/manage-subcategories.php","lineNumber":28,"message":"\t$query=mysqli_query($con,\"delete from tblsubcategory where SubCategoryId='$id'\");","unsafeSourceCode":{"18":"\t$id=intval($_GET['resid']);","19":"\t$query=mysqli_query($con,\"update tblsubcategory set Is_Active='1' where SubCategoryId='$id'\");","20":"\t$msg=\"Category restored successfully\";","21":"}","22":"","23":"\/\/ Code for Forever deletionparmdel","24":"if($_GET['action']=='perdel' && $_GET['scid'])","25":"{","26":"\t$id=intval($_GET['scid']);","27":"\t$query=mysqli_query($con,\"delete from tblsubcategory where SubCategoryId='$id'\");","28":"\t$delmsg=\"Category deleted forever\";","29":"}","30":"","31":"?>","32":"<!DOCTYPE html>","33":"<html lang=\"en\">","34":" <head>","35":"","36":" <title> News | Manage SubCategories<\/title>","37":" <link href=\"assets\/css\/bootstrap.min.css\" rel=\"stylesheet\" type=\"text\/css\" \/>"}},{"severity":1,"category":"SQL Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. SQL injection\r\nattacks are also known as SQL insertion attacks.","filename":"\/newsportal\/admin\/manage-subcategories.php","lineNumber":145,"message":"$query=mysqli_query($con,\"Select tblcategory.CategoryName as catname,tblsubcategory.Subcategory as subcatname,tblsubcategory.SubCatDescription as SubCatDescription,tblsubcategory.PostingDate as subcatpostingdate,tblsubcategory.UpdationDate as subcatupdationdate,tblsubcategory.SubCategoryId as subcatid from tblsubcategory join tblcategory on tblsubcategory.CategoryId=tblcategory.id where tblsubcategory.Is_Active=1\");","unsafeSourceCode":{"135":" <th>Description<\/th>","136":" ","137":" <th>Posting Date<\/th>","138":" <th>Last updation Date<\/th>","139":" <th>Action<\/th>","140":" <\/tr>","141":" <\/thead>","142":" <tbody>","143":"<?php ","144":"$query=mysqli_query($con,\"Select tblcategory.CategoryName as catname,tblsubcategory.Subcategory as subcatname,tblsubcategory.SubCatDescription as SubCatDescription,tblsubcategory.PostingDate as subcatpostingdate,tblsubcategory.UpdationDate as subcatupdationdate,tblsubcategory.SubCategoryId as subcatid from tblsubcategory join tblcategory on tblsubcategory.CategoryId=tblcategory.id where tblsubcategory.Is_Active=1\");","145":"$cnt=1;","146":"$rowcount=mysqli_num_rows($query);","147":"if($rowcount==0)","148":"{","149":"?>","150":"<tr>","151":"","152":"<td colspan=\"7\" align=\"center\"><h3 style=\"color:red\">No record found<\/h3><\/td>","153":"<tr>","154":"<?php "}},{"severity":1,"category":"SQL Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the site on behalf of the\r\nattacker, or to simply steal the session cookie.\r\n\r\nA vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the site on behalf of the\r\nattacker, or to simply steal the session cookie.\r\n\r\nA VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the site on behalf of the\r\nattacker, or to simply steal the session cookie.\r\n\r\nA in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. SQL injection\r\nattacks are also known as SQL insertion attacks.","filename":"\/newsportal\/news-details.php","lineNumber":19,"message":"$query=mysqli_query($con,\"insert into tblcomments(postId,name,email,comment,status) values('$postid','$name','$email','$comment','$st1')\");","unsafeSourceCode":{"9":"{","10":" \/\/Verifying CSRF Token","11":"if (!empty($_POST['csrftoken'])) {","12":" if (hash_equals($_SESSION['token'], $_POST['csrftoken'])) {","13":"$name=$_POST['name'];","14":"$email=$_POST['email'];","15":"$comment=$_POST['comment'];","16":"$postid=intval($_GET['nid']);","17":"$st1='0';","18":"$query=mysqli_query($con,\"insert into tblcomments(postId,name,email,comment,status) values('$postid','$name','$email','$comment','$st1')\");","19":"if($query):","20":" echo \"<script>alert('comment successfully submit. Please try again.');<\/script>\"; ","24":"","25":"endif;","26":"","27":"}","28":"}"}},{"severity":1,"category":"SQL Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. SQL injection\r\nattacks are also known as SQL insertion attacks.","filename":"\/newsportal\/news-details.php","lineNumber":33,"message":" $sql = \"SELECT viewCounter FROM tblposts WHERE id = '$postid'\";","unsafeSourceCode":{"23":" echo \"<script>alert('Something went wrong. Please try again.');<\/script>\"; ","24":"","25":"endif;","26":"","27":"}","28":"}","29":"}","30":"$postid=intval($_GET['nid']);","31":"","32":" $sql = \"SELECT viewCounter FROM tblposts WHERE id = '$postid'\";","33":" $result = $con->query($sql);","34":"","35":" if ($result->num_rows > 0) {","36":" while($row = $result->fetch_assoc()) {","37":" $visits = $row[\"viewCounter\"];","38":" $sql = \"UPDATE tblposts SET viewCounter = $visits+1 WHERE id ='$postid'\";","39":" $con->query($sql);","40":"","41":" }","42":" } else {"}},{"severity":1,"category":"SQL Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following (database),\r\nor cache expirations. Instead, use UTC time or an _offset() variant for your platform.\r\n\r\nFrom PHP:\r\n\tIt is not safe to rely on the system's timezone settings. You are *required* to use the\r\n\tdate.timezone setting or the date_default_timezone_set() function. In case you used any of\r\n\tthose methods and you are still getting this warning, you most likely misspelled the timezone identifier.\r\n\tWe selected the timezone 'UTC' for now, but please set date.timezone to select your timezone.\r\n\r\n\r\nTimezone changes on the server or daylight saving time events cause incorrect comparisons between times.\r\nThis is a larger threat than the system UTC time changing for Windows applications because changing the\r\ntime in Windows requires Administrative privileges, whereas changing the timezone does not.\r\n\r\nIf local time is merely displayed to the user, unexpected changes may only annoy users.\r\nIf local time is used for session or credential expiration, this creates an opportunity for other attacks.\r\nIf local time is used for throttling or caching, this creates an opportunity for denial of service events","references":{"https:\/\/cwe.mitre.org\/data\/definitions\/613.html":"CWE-613: Insufficient Session not use local time values for comparison to each other, long term storage (database),\r\nor cache expirations. Instead, use UTC time or an _offset() variant for your platform.\r\n\r\nFrom PHP:\r\n\tIt is not safe to rely on the system's timezone settings. You are *required* to use the\r\n\tdate.timezone setting or the date_default_timezone_set() function. In case you used any of\r\n\tthose methods and you are still getting this warning, you most likely misspelled the timezone identifier.\r\n\tWe selected the timezone 'UTC' for now, but please set date.timezone to select your timezone.\r\n\r\n\r\nTimezone changes on the server or daylight saving time events cause incorrect comparisons between times.\r\nThis is a larger threat than the system UTC time changing for Windows applications because changing the\r\ntime in Windows requires Administrative privileges, whereas changing the timezone does not.\r\n\r\nIf local time is merely displayed to the user, unexpected changes may only annoy users.\r\nIf local time is used for session or credential expiration, this creates an opportunity for other attacks.\r\nIf local time is used for throttling or caching, this creates an opportunity for denial of service events","references":{"https:\/\/cwe.mitre.org\/data\/definitions\/613.html":"CWE-613: Insufficient Session
